text:
I was born in a small, rural town in the middle of nowhere. My parents were farmers, and I was their only child. Growing up, I was always surrounded by nature, and I loved exploring the outdoors. I loved being able to roam the fields and woods, and I developed a great appreciation for the wildlife and the beauty of nature. 

My parents were always hardworking, and they instilled in me the importance of working hard and being independent. I learned to take responsibility for my own actions, and I developed a strong sense of self-discipline. My parents taught me the value of honesty, and I was taught to always be true to my word. 

School was never my strong suit, but I was always able to get by. I was never a great student, but I was never a bad one either. I was an average student, but I was always able to put in the effort and dedication when it mattered. I also found that I was good at sports, and I was able to make a few friends through that.

As I got older, I became more and more outgoing. I was never the most popular kid, but I was well-liked and enjoyed socializing with my peers. I was always eager to make new friends, and I was always the one to initiate conversations and start new activities. I was also quite extroverted, and I enjoyed being the life of the party. 

My parents were always supportive of my extroverted personality, and I was never discouraged from being myself. They also encouraged me to be creative and to explore my interests. I loved making music, and I was able to hone my skills through the years. I was also very interested in art, and I was able to explore that passion through the years. 

As I got older, I started to develop a more serious outlook on life. I was more open to experience and I started to explore the world in more depth. I took part in a lot of cultural activities, and I became more interested in politics and current events. I also started to take my studies more seriously, and I was able to develop my skills in a range of subjects. 

Overall, my childhood was a good one. I was able to explore and grow, and I was able to develop into the person I am today. I was able to learn the importance of hard work and dedication, and I was able to develop my social skills. I was also able to explore my interests and to develop my creativity. My childhood was a good foundation for the rest of my life.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.
